27#include "hb-subset.hh"
28#include "hb-set.hh"
29#include "hb-utf.hh"

31
32hb_subset_input_t::hb_subset_input_t ()
33{
34 for (auto& set : sets_iter ())
35 set = hb::shared_ptr<hb_set_t> (hb_set_create ());
36
37 if (in_error ())
38 return;
39
40 flags = HB_SUBSET_FLAGS_DEFAULT;
41
42 hb_set_add_range (set: sets.name_ids, first: 0, last: 6);
43 hb_set_add (set: sets.name_languages, codepoint: 0x0409);
44
45 hb_tag_t default_drop_tables[] = {

48 HB_TAG ('m', 'o', 'r', 't'),

50 HB_TAG ('k', 'e', 'r', 'n'),
51

69 sets.drop_tables->add_array (array: default_drop_tables, count: ARRAY_LENGTH (default_drop_tables));

189
190/**
191 * hb_subset_input_create_or_fail:
192 *
193 * Creates a new subset input object.
194 *
195 * Return value: (transfer full): New subset input, or `NULL` if failed. Destroy
196 * with hb_subset_input_destroy().
197 *
198 * Since: 1.8.0
199 **/
200hb_subset_input_t *
201hb_subset_input_create_or_fail (void)
202{
203 hb_subset_input_t *input = hb_object_create<hb_subset_input_t>();
204
205 if (unlikely (!input))
206 return nullptr;
207
208 if (input->in_error ())
209 {
210 hb_subset_input_destroy (input);
211 return nullptr;
212 }
213
214 return input;
215}
216
217/**
218 * hb_subset_input_reference: (skip)
219 * @input: a #hb_subset_input_t object.
220 *
221 * Increases the reference count on @input.
222 *
223 * Return value: @input.
224 *
225 * Since: 1.8.0
226 **/
227hb_subset_input_t *
228hb_subset_input_reference (hb_subset_input_t *input)
229{
230 return hb_object_reference (obj: input);
231}
232
233/**
234 * hb_subset_input_destroy:
235 * @input: a #hb_subset_input_t object.
236 *
237 * Decreases the reference count on @input, and if it reaches zero, destroys
238 * @input, freeing all memory.
239 *
240 * Since: 1.8.0
241 **/
242void
243hb_subset_input_destroy (hb_subset_input_t *input)
244{
245 if (!hb_object_destroy (obj: input)) return;
246
247 hb_free (ptr: input);
248}
249
250/**
251 * hb_subset_input_unicode_set:
252 * @input: a #hb_subset_input_t object.
253 *
254 * Gets the set of Unicode code points to retain, the caller should modify the
255 * set as needed.
256 *
257 * Return value: (transfer none): pointer to the #hb_set_t of Unicode code
258 * points.
259 *
260 * Since: 1.8.0
261 **/
262HB_EXTERN hb_set_t *
263hb_subset_input_unicode_set (hb_subset_input_t *input)
264{
265 return input->sets.unicodes;
266}
267
268/**
269 * hb_subset_input_glyph_set:
270 * @input: a #hb_subset_input_t object.
271 *
272 * Gets the set of glyph IDs to retain, the caller should modify the set as
273 * needed.
274 *
275 * Return value: (transfer none): pointer to the #hb_set_t of glyph IDs.
276 *
277 * Since: 1.8.0
278 **/
279HB_EXTERN hb_set_t *
280hb_subset_input_glyph_set (hb_subset_input_t *input)
281{
282 return input->sets.glyphs;
283}
284
285/**
286 * hb_subset_input_set:
287 * @input: a #hb_subset_input_t object.
288 * @set_type: a #hb_subset_sets_t set type.
289 *
290 * Gets the set of the specified type.
291 *
292 * Return value: (transfer none): pointer to the #hb_set_t of the specified type.
293 *
294 * Since: 2.9.1
295 **/
296HB_EXTERN hb_set_t *
297hb_subset_input_set (hb_subset_input_t *input, hb_subset_sets_t set_type)
298{
299 return input->sets_iter () [set_type];
300}
301
302/**
303 * hb_subset_input_get_flags:
304 * @input: a #hb_subset_input_t object.
305 *
306 * Gets all of the subsetting flags in the input object.
307 *
308 * Return value: the subsetting flags bit field.
309 *
310 * Since: 2.9.0
311 **/
312HB_EXTERN hb_subset_flags_t
313hb_subset_input_get_flags (hb_subset_input_t *input)
314{
315 return (hb_subset_flags_t) input->flags;
316}
317
318/**
319 * hb_subset_input_set_flags:
320 * @input: a #hb_subset_input_t object.
321 * @value: bit field of flags
322 *
323 * Sets all of the flags in the input object to the values specified by the bit
324 * field.
325 *
326 * Since: 2.9.0
327 **/
328HB_EXTERN void
329hb_subset_input_set_flags (hb_subset_input_t *input,
330 unsigned value)
331{
332 input->flags = (hb_subset_flags_t) value;
333}
334
335/**
336 * hb_subset_input_set_user_data: (skip)
337 * @input: a #hb_subset_input_t object.
338 * @key: The user-data key to set
339 * @data: A pointer to the user data
340 * @destroy: (nullable): A callback to call when @data is not needed anymore
341 * @replace: Whether to replace an existing data with the same key
342 *
343 * Attaches a user-data key/data pair to the given subset input object.
344 *
345 * Return value: `true` if success, `false` otherwise
346 *
347 * Since: 2.9.0
348 **/
349hb_bool_t
350hb_subset_input_set_user_data (hb_subset_input_t *input,
351 hb_user_data_key_t *key,
352 void * data,
353 hb_destroy_func_t destroy,
354 hb_bool_t replace)
355{
356 return hb_object_set_user_data (obj: input, key, data, destroy, replace);
357}
358
359/**
360 * hb_subset_input_get_user_data: (skip)
361 * @input: a #hb_subset_input_t object.
362 * @key: The user-data key to query
363 *
364 * Fetches the user data associated with the specified key,
365 * attached to the specified subset input object.
366 *
367 * Return value: (transfer none): A pointer to the user data
368 *
369 * Since: 2.9.0
370 **/
371void *
372hb_subset_input_get_user_data (const hb_subset_input_t *input,
373 hb_user_data_key_t *key)
374{
375 return hb_object_get_user_data (obj: input, key);
376}
377
378/**
379 * hb_subset_input_keep_everything:
380 * @input: a #hb_subset_input_t object
381 *
382 * Configure input object to keep everything in the font face.
383 * That is, all Unicodes, glyphs, names, layout items,
384 * glyph names, etc.
385 *
386 * The input can be tailored afterwards by the caller.
387 *
388 * Since: 7.0.0
389 */
390void
391hb_subset_input_keep_everything (hb_subset_input_t *input)
392{
393 const hb_subset_sets_t indices[] = {HB_SUBSET_SETS_UNICODE,
394 HB_SUBSET_SETS_GLYPH_INDEX,
395 HB_SUBSET_SETS_NAME_ID,
396 HB_SUBSET_SETS_NAME_LANG_ID,
397 HB_SUBSET_SETS_LAYOUT_FEATURE_TAG,
398 HB_SUBSET_SETS_LAYOUT_SCRIPT_TAG};
399
400 for (auto idx : hb_iter (indices))
401 {
402 hb_set_t *set = hb_subset_input_set (input, set_type: idx);
403 hb_set_clear (set);
404 hb_set_invert (set);
405 }
406
407 // Don't drop any tables
408 hb_set_clear (set: hb_subset_input_set (input, set_type: HB_SUBSET_SETS_DROP_TABLE_TAG));
409
410 hb_subset_input_set_flags (input,
411 value: HB_SUBSET_FLAGS_NOTDEF_OUTLINE |
412 HB_SUBSET_FLAGS_GLYPH_NAMES |
413 HB_SUBSET_FLAGS_NO_PRUNE_UNICODE_RANGES |
414 HB_SUBSET_FLAGS_PASSTHROUGH_UNRECOGNIZED);
415}
416
417#ifndef HB_NO_VAR
418/**
419 * hb_subset_input_pin_axis_to_default: (skip)
420 * @input: a #hb_subset_input_t object.
421 * @face: a #hb_face_t object.
422 * @axis_tag: Tag of the axis to be pinned
423 *
424 * Pin an axis to its default location in the given subset input object.
425 *
426 * All axes in a font must be pinned. Additionally, `CFF2` table, if present,
427 * will be de-subroutinized.
428 *
429 * Return value: `true` if success, `false` otherwise
430 *
431 * Since: 6.0.0
432 **/
433HB_EXTERN hb_bool_t
434hb_subset_input_pin_axis_to_default (hb_subset_input_t *input,
435 hb_face_t *face,
436 hb_tag_t axis_tag)
437{
438 hb_ot_var_axis_info_t axis_info;
439 if (!hb_ot_var_find_axis_info (face, axis_tag, axis_info: &axis_info))
440 return false;
441
442 return input->axes_location.set (key: axis_tag, value&: axis_info.default_value);
443}
444
445/**
446 * hb_subset_input_pin_axis_location: (skip)
447 * @input: a #hb_subset_input_t object.
448 * @face: a #hb_face_t object.
449 * @axis_tag: Tag of the axis to be pinned
450 * @axis_value: Location on the axis to be pinned at
451 *
452 * Pin an axis to a fixed location in the given subset input object.
453 *
454 * All axes in a font must be pinned. Additionally, `CFF2` table, if present,
455 * will be de-subroutinized.
456 *
457 * Return value: `true` if success, `false` otherwise
458 *
459 * Since: 6.0.0
460 **/
461HB_EXTERN hb_bool_t
462hb_subset_input_pin_axis_location (hb_subset_input_t *input,
463 hb_face_t *face,
464 hb_tag_t axis_tag,
465 float axis_value)
466{
467 hb_ot_var_axis_info_t axis_info;
468 if (!hb_ot_var_find_axis_info (face, axis_tag, axis_info: &axis_info))
469 return false;
470
471 float val = hb_clamp(axis_value, axis_info.min_value, axis_info.max_value);
472 return input->axes_location.set (key: axis_tag, value&: val);
473}
474#endif
475
476/**
477 * hb_subset_preprocess:
478 * @source: a #hb_face_t object.
479 *
480 * Preprocesses the face and attaches data that will be needed by the
481 * subsetter. Future subsetting operations can then use the precomputed data
482 * to speed up the subsetting operation.
483 *
484 * See [subset-preprocessing](https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/blob/main/docs/subset-preprocessing.md)
485 * for more information.
486 *
487 * Note: the preprocessed face may contain sub-blobs that reference the memory
488 * backing the source #hb_face_t. Therefore in the case that this memory is not
489 * owned by the source face you will need to ensure that memory lives
490 * as long as the returned #hb_face_t.
491 *
492 * Returns: a new #hb_face_t.
493 *
494 * Since: 6.0.0
495 **/
496
497HB_EXTERN hb_face_t *
498hb_subset_preprocess (hb_face_t *source)
499{
500 hb_subset_input_t* input = hb_subset_input_create_or_fail ();
501 if (!input)
502 return hb_face_reference (face: source);
503
504 hb_subset_input_keep_everything (input);
505
506 input->attach_accelerator_data = true;
507
508 // Always use long loca in the preprocessed version. This allows
509 // us to store the glyph bytes unpadded which allows the future subset
510 // operation to run faster by skipping the trim padding step.
511 input->force_long_loca = true;
512
513 hb_face_t* new_source = hb_subset_or_fail (source, input);
514 hb_subset_input_destroy (input);
515
516 if (!new_source) {
517 DEBUG_MSG (SUBSET, nullptr, "Preprocessing failed due to subset failure.");
518 return hb_face_reference (face: source);
519 }
520
521 return new_source;
522}
523
524#ifdef HB_EXPERIMENTAL_API
525/**
526 * hb_subset_input_override_name_table:
527 * @input: a #hb_subset_input_t object.
528 * @name_id: name_id of a nameRecord
529 * @platform_id: platform ID of a nameRecord
530 * @encoding_id: encoding ID of a nameRecord
531 * @language_id: language ID of a nameRecord
532 * @name_str: pointer to name string new value or null to indicate should remove
533 * @str_len: the size of @name_str, or -1 if it is `NULL`-terminated
534 *
535 * Override the name string of the NameRecord identified by name_id,
536 * platform_id, encoding_id and language_id. If a record with that name_id
537 * doesn't exist, create it and insert to the name table.
538 *
539 * Note: for mac platform, we only support name_str with all ascii characters,
540 * name_str with non-ascii characters will be ignored.
541 *
542 * XSince: EXPERIMENTAL
543 **/
544HB_EXTERN hb_bool_t
545hb_subset_input_override_name_table (hb_subset_input_t *input,
546 hb_ot_name_id_t name_id,
547 unsigned platform_id,
548 unsigned encoding_id,
549 unsigned language_id,
550 const char *name_str,
551 int str_len /* -1 means nul-terminated */)
552{
553 if (!name_str)
554 {
555 str_len = 0;
556 }
557 else if (str_len == -1)
558 {
559 str_len = strlen (name_str);
560 }
561
562 hb_bytes_t name_bytes (nullptr, 0);
563 if (str_len)
564 {
565 if (platform_id == 1)
566 {
567 const uint8_t *src = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*> (name_str);
568 const uint8_t *src_end = src + str_len;
569
570 hb_codepoint_t unicode;
571 const hb_codepoint_t replacement = HB_BUFFER_REPLACEMENT_CODEPOINT_DEFAULT;
572 while (src < src_end)
573 {
574 src = hb_utf8_t::next (src, src_end, &unicode, replacement);
575 if (unicode >= 0x0080u)
576 {
577 printf ("Non-ascii character detected, ignored...This API supports acsii characters only for mac platform\n");
578 return false;
579 }
580 }
581 }
582 char *override_name = (char *) hb_malloc (str_len);
583 if (unlikely (!override_name)) return false;
584
585 hb_memcpy (override_name, name_str, str_len);
586 name_bytes = hb_bytes_t (override_name, str_len);
587 }
588 input->name_table_overrides.set (hb_ot_name_record_ids_t (platform_id, encoding_id, language_id, name_id), name_bytes);
589 return true;
590}
591
592#endif
